Industry touchdown: Stadium construction promises work for local businesses
- Office and Industrial relocation and expansion expert.- Developer of dynamic strategies for successful next generation economies.

Achievements:•	Authored business recruitment strategies for domestic and international markets.•	Partnered with local non-profit organization to help refine their business strategies to assist in attraction and expansion of small/start-up businesses in the food and innovation industries and well as workforce development programs.•	Worked with DEGC real estate team to develop and implement a comprehensive public land assemblage initiative.Responsibilities:•	Represented the DEGC at conference, trade shows, and sales missions•	Managed team of seven business development managers and directors.•	Negotiated deal terms with clients on behalf of the city.•	Developed business cases for our primary target industries.o	Advanced Manufacturingo	Innovationo	Transportation, Distribution, and Logisticso	Professional Services and Corporate Headquarters•	Authored deal proposals and negotiated development agreements with prospects and City Attorney.•	Presented abatement deals to the Detroit City Council.
City of Mesa - Office of Economic Development

Achievements:•	Authored redevelopment strategies (municipal incentive package) for the City’s Fiesta District specifically designed to attract high value jobs in the Life Science industries as well as stimulate private sector research and development opportunities.•	Developed international initiative designed to connect supply chain partners in Mexico with Mesa businesses.•	Partnered with surrounding municipalities to develop the “Global Connect” workshop. The event was offered as part of an international trade educational series for small to mid size businesses in the region to learn about federal, state, and municipal programs that where available to help achieve their international trade goals.Responsibilities:•	Represented the City at Trade Shows, IEDC related events.•	Managed sales pipeline of recruitment prospects.•	Negotiated deal terms with clients on behalf of the city.•	Managed the ongoing execution of the Falcon Field Economic Activity Area strategic vision.o	Outreach to affected property ownerso	Development of Branding and Marketingo	Business Recruitment to the Airport and surrounding areas.o	Business Retention and Expansiono	Quality Neighborhood planningo	Working with city staff to fine tune existing zoning via Planned Area Development (PAD) protocols.•	Authored deal proposals and negotiated development agreements with prospects and City Attorney.•	Presented progress reports to Mesa City Council, Sub-committees, and Advisory boards.•	Represented the City during international and domestic sales delegations.

Community Relations- Working with communities throughout Arizona to improve their industry/business profilesPublic Policy- Co-Authored FY2014 Arizona Rural Development Grant Program- Co-Authored Arizona Certified Sites & Certified Buildings ProgramLeadership- Staff for the Arizona Commerce Authority Rural Business Development Advisory CommitteeDeal Making- Work hand in hand with municipalities, economic development organizations, and the private sector to create new high value Arizona jobs.Location Advocate- Increase awareness towards Rural Location options for private sector location/infrastructure needs.

Achievements:- Attracted the relocation and/or expansion of companies into the Arizona market. Examples of these include: Bridgestone North America, Bechtel, Accerl8 Technologies, Commonwealth Dairy, LLC, Ehrmann AG, Franklin Foods, BP Wind Energy, and General Motors.- Developed a strong network with site selectors, corporate financial advisers, real estate brokers, and various CFO’s throughout the United States.- Represented the Arizona Commerce Authority (ACA) and trade shows and conferences throughout the country, including: CoreNet Global, BIO International, Medical Design & Device Conference, and Expansion Management Magazine Round tables.- Calculated incentive benefits and worked with the CEO to design customized proposals to clients and contracts with targeted performance measures (Jobs, Capital Investment, Wages, Healthcare Contributions, etc.) to ensure benefit to the company and return on investment to the state.

- Managed and developed annual Marketing strategies, consisting of advertising placement in target trade publications and websites such as: The Hollywood Reporter, MovieMaker, Production Update, DGA Monthly/DGA Quarterly, Produced By, Variety, The Hollywood Reporter- Represented the office at industry related trade shows and conferences worldwide: AFCI Locations Trade Show, Arizona Black Film Showcase, Phoenix Film Festival, Puro Mexicano: Tucson Film Festival, ARTFARE the MUSE, AFCI Cineposium, Phoenix Film Festival> Oversaw all Marketing, Advertising, and Brand Management projects, including work with outside vendors> Managed Administrative Personnel.> Facilitated and presented quarterly reports on marketing efforts, projects, and overall activities affected by the office to the Arizona Governor’s Film and Television Advisory Commission.

Achievements: - Advised clients regarding talking points, message    development, and formal protocols to prepare them for testimony in front of city, state and federal elected bodies.- Educated elected officials on client bills.- Researched proposed legislation and current Arizona Revised Statutes to formulate strategy that would advance our clients government relations needs.- Designed artwork and other materials for political fundraising events.Responsibilities:> Previewed and summarized legislation that was pertinent to client base.> Testified on behalf of clients in Arizona Legislative Committee Hearings.> Coordinated fundraising events for city, state, and federal campaigns.
